Docs.summary: Layers a new protocol on top of a connection.

remarks.para: Layers a new protocol on top of a connection. This is typically used to create a TLS/SSL connection through a proxy. The route is the one previously passed to . It is not guaranteed that the layered connection is .

MemberSignature.Value: public void MarkReusable ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void MarkReusable() cil managed

Docs.summary: Marks this connection as being in a reusable communication state.

remarks.para:
Marks this connection as being in a reusable communication state. The checkpoints for reuseable communication states (in the absence of pipelining) are before sending a request and after receiving the response in it's entirety. The connection will automatically clear the checkpoint when used for communication. A call to this method indicates that the next checkpoint has been reached.
A reusable communication state is necessary but not sufficient for the connection to be reused. A mismatch, the connection being closed, or other circumstances might prevent reuse.

MemberSignature.Value: public void SetIdleDuration (long duration, Java.Util.Concurrent.TimeUnit unit);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void SetIdleDuration(int64 duration, class Java.Util.Concurrent.TimeUnit unit) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the duration that this connection can remain idle before it is reused.

remarks.para: Sets the duration that this connection can remain idle before it is reused. The connection should not be used again if this time elapses. The idle duration must be reset after each request sent over this connection. The elapsed time starts counting when the connection is released, which is typically after the headers (and any response body, if present) is fully consumed.

MemberSignature.Value: public Javax.Net.Ssl.ISSLSession SSLSession { get; }
.property instance class Javax.Net.Ssl.ISSLSession SSLSession

Attribute.AttributeName: get: Android.Runtime.Register("getSSLSession", "()Ljavax/net/ssl/SSLSession;", "GetGetSSLSessionHandler:Org.Apache.Http.Conn.IManagedClientConnectionInvoker, Mono.Android, Version=0.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null")

Docs.summary: Obtains the SSL session of the underlying connection, if any.

remarks.para:
Obtains the SSL session of the underlying connection, if any. If this connection is open, and the underlying socket is an , the SSL session of that socket is obtained. This is a potentially blocking operation.
Note: Whether the underlying socket is an SSL socket can not necessarily be determined via . Plain sockets may be considered secure, for example if they are connected to a known host in the same network segment. On the other hand, SSL sockets may be considered insecure, for example depending on the chosen cipher suite.

MemberSignature.Value: public void TunnelProxy (Org.Apache.Http.HttpHost next, bool secure, Org.Apache.Http.Params.IHttpParams params);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void TunnelProxy(class Org.Apache.Http.HttpHost next, bool secure, class Org.Apache.Http.Params.IHttpParams params) cil managed

Docs.param: the proxy to which the tunnel was established. This is not the proxy through which the tunnel was established, but the new end point of the tunnel. The tunnel does not yet reach to the target, use to indicate an end-to-end tunnel.
true if the connection should be considered secure, false otherwise
the parameters for tunnelling this connection
Docs.summary: Indicates that a tunnel to an intermediate proxy has been established.

remarks.para: Indicates that a tunnel to an intermediate proxy has been established. This is used exclusively for so-called proxy chains, where a request has to pass through multiple proxies before reaching the target. In that case, all proxies but the last need to be tunnelled when establishing the connection. Tunnelling of the last proxy to the target is optional and would be indicated via .

MemberSignature.Value: public void TunnelTarget (bool secure, Org.Apache.Http.Params.IHttpParams params);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void TunnelTarget(bool secure, class Org.Apache.Http.Params.IHttpParams params) cil managed

Docs.param: true if the tunnel should be considered secure, false otherwise
the parameters for tunnelling this connection
Docs.summary: Indicates that a tunnel to the target has been established.

remarks.para:
Indicates that a tunnel to the target has been established. The route is the one previously passed to . Subsequently, can be called to layer the TLS/SSL protocol on top of the tunnelled connection.
Note: In HttpClient 3, a call to the corresponding method would automatically trigger the layering of the TLS/SSL protocol. This is not the case anymore, you can establish a tunnel without layering a new protocol over the connection.

MemberSignature.Value: public void UnmarkReusable ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void UnmarkReusable() cil managed

Docs.summary: Marks this connection as not being in a reusable state.

remarks.para:
Marks this connection as not being in a reusable state. This can be used immediately before releasing this connection to prevent it's reuse. Reasons for preventing reuse include error conditions and the evaluation of a .
Note: It is not necessary to call here before writing to or reading from this connection. Communication attempts will automatically unmark the state as non-reusable. It can then be switched back using .
